modName: UI Tweaks - Alternative style for Mod Organizer
summary: Theme for Mod Organizer, based on the default style with better and cleaner UI elements.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/e6cnfQl.jpg[/img][/center]


[size=3][b]UI TWEAKS[/b] is my personal attempt to tweak and improve the default theme of [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1334]Mod Organizer[/url], without deviating to much in terms of colours and general aesthetics.


[b][color=#ffff00][size=4]Features[/size][/color][/b]
[/size][list]
[*][size=3]Sexy checkboxes with different colours for checked/unchecked states, making them easier to distinguish when quickly scanning long lists[/size]
[*][size=3]Parent/Children categories [size=3]hierarchy [/size]is now properly displayed in filter list[/size]
[*][size=3]Scrollbars are more smooth and elegant[/size]
[*][size=3]Improved tree view with matching +/- icons.[/size]
[*][size=3]Less redundant borders for a cleaner [s]and immersive[/s] experience ;-)[/size]
[/list]

[color=#ffff00][size=4][b]Installation[/b][/size][/color]
[list=1]
[*][size=3]Download the file and unzip it directly inside Mod Organizer installation folder. You will end with 1 .qss file and the ui-tweaks images folder inside MO’s stylesheets directory. (File path: <where you installed MO>\Mod Organizer\stylesheets).[/size]
[*][size=3] In MO go to [u]Settings[/u] > [u]Style[/u] > [u]UI-Tweaks.qss[/u][/size]
[/list]
[size=3][b]Uninstallation[/b]:
[/size][size=3]Delete iu-tweaks.qss and the corresponding iu-[size=3]tweaks[/size] folder from [/size][size=3]Mod Organizer\stylesheets directory.


[b][color=#ffff00][size=4]Requirements[/size][/color][/b]
7-Zip and (obviously) Mod Organizer.


[b][color=#ffff00][size=4]Future Plans[/size][/color][/b]
I did this for my personal use and curiosity with QSS giving the fact I'm a professional web designer and CSS coder. The result was good so I thought of sharing it, but I don't have any further plans for now (except fixing bugs if someone finds one).

Please feel free to modify the style sheet further and use it as a base for your own theme! All the (very simple) code is commented by sections for an easy understanding.


[b][color=#ffff00][size=4]Known Issues[/size][/color][/b]
[/size][list]
[*][size=3]In the filter list, when a first level category with children is open, the next first level category will not show an alternate dash with a rounded top (as originally intended). Sadly it seems is not possible (or I was not able) to target that particular circumstance with the current code of MO and the css support given by QT.[/size]
[*][size=3]When a filter is active, the left panel is surrounded by a red border. This effect is hard-coded in MO and I was not able to overwrite it. I was able though to mitigate the "jump effect" that happens from suddenly having a border, so at least the transition should be seamless. [/size]
[/list][size=3]

[b][color=#ffff00][size=4]Legal Notice[/size][/color][/b]
This is a very simple work, so I publish it under PUBLIC DOMAIN (AKA you can do whatever you want, I don't care).
If you want to incorporate this style in your own work, credit is not needed but is appreciate nevertheless.
[/size]
author: EGraf
